database1_test module

database1_test.sample_customer1()[source]

Fixture for a sample customer. :return: Dictionary representing a sample customer. :rtype: dict

database1_test.sample_customer2()[source]

Fixture for another sample customer :return: Dictionary representing a sample customer. :rtype: dict

database1_test.sample_customer3()[source]

Fixture for another sample customer. :return: Dictionary representing a sample customer. :rtype: dict

database1_test.sample_customer4()[source]

Fixture for another sample customer. :return: Dictionary representing a sample customer. :rtype: dict

database1_test.setup_test_database()[source]

Fixture to set up a test database and create the customers table.

database1_test.test_charge_customer_wallet(setup_test_database, sample_customer2)[source]

Test if charging a customer’s wallet is successful. :param setup_test_database: Fixture to set up the test database. :param sample_customer2: Fixture for a sample customer data dictionary

database1_test.test_connect_to_db()[source]

Test if connecting to the database is successful.

database1_test.test_create_customers_table(setup_test_database)[source]

Test if creating the customers table is successful. The setup_test_database fixture ensures that the table is created before running this test. :param setup_test_database: Fixture to set up the test database.

database1_test.test_deduce_money_from_wallet(setup_test_database, sample_customer3)[source]

Test if deducting money from a customer’s wallet is successful. Already inserted customer 2 in a previous test. :param setup_test_database: Fixture to set up the test database. :param sample_customer3: Fixture for a sample customer data dictionary

database1_test.test_delete_customer(setup_test_database, sample_customer2)[source]

Test if deleting a customer is successful. :param setup_test_database: Fixture to set up the test database. :param sample_customer2: Fixture for a sample customer data dictionary

database1_test.test_get_all_customers(setup_test_database, sample_customer1)[source]

Test if getting all customers returns the correct number of customers. :param setup_test_database: Fixture to set up the test database. :param sample_customer1: Fixture for a sample customer data dictionary.

database1_test.test_get_customer_by_id(setup_test_database, sample_customer4)[source]

Test if getting a customer by ID returns the correct customer. :param setup_test_database: Fixture to set up the test database. :param sample_customer4: Fixture for a sample customer data dictionary.

database1_test.test_get_customer_by_username(setup_test_database, sample_customer1)[source]

Test if getting a customer by username returns the correct customer. :param setup_test_database: Fixture to set up the test database. :param sample_customer1: Fixture for a sample customer data dictionary.

database1_test.test_insert_customer(setup_test_database, sample_customer1)[source]

Test if inserting a customer is successful. :param setup_test_database: Fixture to set up the test database. :param sample_customer1: Fixture for a sample customer data dictionary.

database1_test.test_insert_customer_duplicate_username(setup_test_database, sample_customer1)[source]

Test if inserting a customer with a duplicate username raises an error. :param setup_test_database: Fixture to set up the test database. :param sample_customer1: Fixture for a sample customer data dictionary.

database1_test.test_update_customer(setup_test_database, sample_customer2)[source]

Test if updating a customer is successful. :param setup_test_database: Fixture to set up the test database. :param sample_customer2: Fixture for a sample customer data dictionary
